location.displayAddress: Mushrif Park, Deira

name: Mushrif Park
description: It is 15 kilometres away from the city centre and is the largest park in Dubai. Many facilities are available for families on more than 30 family zones inside the park. It is located in the eastern part of the city, about 16 km from the traditional center of Dubai.
facilities: Mushrif park has international village which contains 13 models of Arabic and English houses. The park also contains of amusing and entertaining services such as: pool, BBQ areas, children games,  sport playground (basket ball, volleyball, hand ball), walking tracks and bicycle tracks, horse and camel riding, and theater that fits 500 people.
entryFees: Membership: Annual (340 AED) or 6 months (260 AED) membership can be obtained to use the swimming pool

location.displayAddress: Mamzar Beach Park, Deira

name: Mamzar Beach Park
description: Al Mamzar Park covers an area of 106 hectares and offers barbecue sites, private chalets for hire, swimming pool, food kiosks, sheltered beach and safe lagoon, a scenic train and many children?s play areas. Piped music is played throughout the day and there are pleasant grassed picnic areas.. It is located approximately 5 km after the turn off to Hamriya Port.
facilities: The park encompasses a large swimming pool divided into 3 pools for children and adults. Seats, shades, changing rooms, showers and a snackhouse are available, in addition to the permanent presence of lifeguards. Facilities include pool, BBQ areas, children games,  sport playground (basket ball, volleyball, hand ball), Restaurants and cafeterias, beach cabins, and renting bicycles.
entryFees: Service of renting the beach cabins: large cabin for AED 200 and small cabin for AED 150

location.displayAddress: Safa Park, Sheikh Zayed Road

name: Safa Park
description: Safa Park is a 64 hectare urban park. The park contains three lakes, over 200 species of birds, and 16,924 different trees and bushes. Within the park, one can find grassy lawns, a little forest, and a hill to offer panoramic views of the park. A waterfall flows out of the hill and into the largest lake which contains a fountain and touring boats.
facilities: Facilities There is a small garden allocated for ladies, entertainment games, sports fields for (Basketball, football & volleyball), renting bicycles, boat rent services, .

location.displayAddress: Zabeel Park, Sheikh Rashid Road

name: Zabeel Park
description: The main features include a 45-metre high Panoramic Tower, Technology Zone, Sports Area, Barcode Garden, Energy Zone, Space Maze, restaurant, and skate park. Entrance Fees/Dhs: 5 per person. Is situated on both sides of the Sheikh Zayed highway heading towards Zabeel.
facilities: Facilities include: Ice rink and ice skating, lessons available. Children's party and activity rooms. Internet WiFi access throughout the whole park. 3D entertainment and cinema.

location.displayAddress: Jumeirah Beach Park, Jumeurah Road

name: Jumeirah Beach Park
description: Jumeirah Beach Park spans 12 hectares of parkland. It is a marvelous painting of landscaping and environmental coordination. The Park was opened in 1989 on 13 hectares of land, to be the first beach park, overlooking directly the Arabian Gulf in Jumeirah residential area. Different earth levels distinguish the park, constituting a group of green hills encompassing recreational and games areas.
facilities: Facilities include: Beach facilities. Beach sport fields services (Basketball, volleyball and handball fields). Playgrounds. Restaurants and cafeterias.
hours: Mondays are allocated for ladies and children only

location.displayAddress: Creek Park, Dubai Creek

name: Creek Park
description: Dubai Creek Park is in the heart of the old city on the shores of Dubai Creek. It is one of the oldest parks in Dubai and is still as popular today as it was then… families fill the park at the weekends and the evenings. The park has the benefit of being in the cool breeze from the creek and also has loads of plants and greenery along with mazes and a nature trail. There are also barbeque areas and childrens’ play areas dotted throughout the park as well as the Children City Centre and Dubai Dolphinarium.
facilities: Facilities include: Teleferic which is manifested by the hanged cabins. Sea excursion services.

location.displayAddress: Dubai Zoo, Jumeirah Beach Road

name: Dubai Zoo
description: Dubai Zoo a 1.5-hectare zoo originally built in 1967. The Zoo includes a group of animals that fits to UAE environment, and in other environments from all over the world. The group includes local animals under threat of extinction, such as Arabian Oryx, Socotra cormorant and wild cat. In addition, the zoo has put breeding program, which includes gorillas, chimpanzees and the African tiger that covered by protection and breeding program.
facilities: Facilities include: Public facilities services (WC for men, women and for people with special needs). Cafe providing beverages, sweets, ice cream and presents are available
hours: Summer timing: from 10:00 am to 06:00 pm, from 1st  of March to the end of October.
Winter timing: from 10:00 am to 5:30 pm from the beginning of November to the end of February.
The zoo is closed on Tuesday

location.displayAddress: Children City, Creek Park

name: Children City
description: The Dubai-based Children's City is the first educational city in the UAE devoted to children between two and fifteen years old where they can investigate, explore, play, discover, and learn about the world in which we live. The City is specially designed for children to interact and discover together in family and school groups.
facilities: Facilities include: Planetarium. Cafe. Nursing room. Gift Shop. WiFi. Education Services. Special Events..

location.displayAddress: Al Majaz Park, Sharjah

name: Al Majaz Park and Waterfront
description: Al Majaz Park is one of the modern public gardens in the city and is close to the Khaled Lagoon. It has a central area for holding ceremonies and is a very popular place with plenty of child friendly facilities. The Waterfront is an expansion and beautification of the existing park, going above and beyond merely extending greenery in order to enhance this family-friendly leisure area, a waterfront landmark of Sharjah. The final 231,000 sqm park is being completely re-developed to include leisure and recreational areas.
facilities: Kids area. Sharjah Fountain. Restaurants and cafes.

location.displayAddress: Green Belt Park, Al Riqa Suburb, Sharjah

name: Green Belt Park
description: Green Belt Park (for ladies only) lies in the northeast part of the city of Sharjah, close to the Al Thaqafa (Cultural) Roundabout. The park also includes water fountains and an open theatre with four main gates.
facilities: Gardens. Fountains. Small Lake

location.displayAddress: Sharjah National Park, Al Gharayen, Al Dhaid Rd

name: Sharjah National Park
description: This is Sharjah's biggest park covering 630,000 square metres and is located at Intersection No. 5, Sharjah/Al Dhaid Road.
facilities: The park contains models of Sharjah malls and Sharjah tourist places. Walking track. Children area.

location.displayAddress: Al Jazeera Fun Park, Al Arouba St, Sharjah

name: Al Jazeera Fun Park
description: Built on a 100,000 square metre island in the lagoon nestles Al Jazeera Fun Park, one of Sharjah’s best loved treasures and a tranquil oasis away from the bustle of the city. For almost three decades this Park has entranced generations of youngsters who now bring their own children to experience its magic.
facilities: Swimming Pool. Mini Zoo. Different Rides
hours: The park is currently undergoing major renovations.

location.displayAddress: Sharjah Desert Park, Al Dhaid Rd, Sharjah

name: Sharjah Desert Park
description: The park covers an area of one square kilometre and offers three venues in one with the Sharjah Natural History Museum and Botanical Museum, Arabia’s Wildlife Centre and the Children’s Farm. The Breeding Centre for Endangered Arabian Wildlife is also located at the park and is an impressive research and breeding facility, but one that is not open to the public.
facilities: Natural History Museum. Botanical Museum. Wildlife Centre. Children Farm
entryFees: School Visits: AED 2 per student ( 3 supervisors free per 60 students)

location.displayAddress: Al Mushrif Children Garden, Al Mushrif district, Abu Dhabi

name: Al Mushrif Children Garden
description: Al Mushrif Children Garden is a wonderful place to take the kids and have a bit of fun. It has amusement park rides (with varying fees), swings, fountains and ample car parking. It's a popular ladies only facility so photography is not allowed.
facilities: Amusement park. Swings.

location.displayAddress: Al Nahyan Garden, 1st St, Corniche Abu Dhabi

name: Al Nahyan Garden
description: Al Nahyan Garden is a well maintained and compact park near the Sheraton Khalidiya Hotel.
facilities: None

location.displayAddress: Capital Gardens, Al Markaziyah district, Corniche Abu Dhabi

name: Capital Gardens
description: Capital Gardens is a welcome patch of green in the middle of the city (op opposite NBAD, Al Markaziyah district, Abu Dhabi) Each little garden cove has a small selection of climbing frames, swings and slides.
facilities: Cafeteria. Vending Machines. Pond

location.displayAddress: Khalidiyah Garden, Sheikh Zayed the 1st St, Abu Dhabi

name: Khalidiyah Garden
description: Capital Gardens is a welcome patch of green in the middle of the city (op opposite NBAD, Al Markaziyah district, Abu Dhabi) Each little garden cove has a small selection of climbing frames, swings and slides.
facilities: Cafeteria. Vending Machines. Pond

location.displayAddress: Khalifa Park, Opposite Al Qarm Corniche, Abu Dhabi

name: Khalifa Park
description: Khalifa Park is one of the city's larger parks and a major landmark. Inspiration for the gardens has been drawn from Arabic and Islamic architecture and from the world's great gardens. The landscape boasts canals, fountains, lakes and waterfalls.
facilities: Miniature railway. Picnic facilities . Auditorium. Murjan Splash Park

location.displayAddress: Al Ain Ladies Park, Zayed Al Awwal St, Al Muwaiji, Al Ain

name: Al Ain Ladies (Basra) Park
description: Al Ain Ladies Park, also commonly known as Basra Park is a quiet and attractive garden is for women and children only (boys under the age of 10). If you are looking for somewhere to sit and enjoy the peace, there are plenty of benches under the shady trees. Play areas with swings, slides and climbing frames are sure to keep the kids busy.
facilities: Snack bar.

location.displayAddress: Al Ain Paradise Garden, Nahyan Al Awal Street at the Zakher roundabout, Al Ain

name: Al Ain Paradise Garden
description: An expansive park – the size of four football pitches – Al Ain Paradise Garden  is home to approximately 10 million flowers, a 12 metre tall replica of the Eiffel Tower and it holds the Guinness World Record for the most hanging baskets, having 2,968 in total.
facilities: NA
hours: Please make sure the park is open before you visit. It was closed early 2013.

location.displayAddress: Al Ain Public Garden, Zayed Bin Sultan St, Al Ain

name: Al Ain Public Garden (Al Jaheli Park)
description: The main park in Al Ain (on Zayed Bin Sultan Street), Al Ain Public Garden is a tranquil spot amid the hustle and bustle. Walkways meander under shady trees, fountains are attractively lit at night and areas for younger children have a variety of play equipment.
facilities: Amusement arcade
hours: Please make sure the park is open before you visit. It was closed early 2013.

location.displayAddress: Ice Land Water Park, Al Riffa, RAK

name: Ice Land Water Park
description: The Ice Land Water Park is the first offering of the WOW RAK destination, a unique water park with extensive theming in snow and ice offering a mix of traditional water park attractions as well as non conventional and novel water park attractions.
facilities: The park features many attractions and rides for all ages.

location.displayAddress: Wadi Adventure, Jabel Hafeet, Al Ain

name: Wadi Adventure
description: Wadi Adventure is the Middle East’s first man made whitewater rafting, kayaking and surf facility, located at the base of Jebel Hafeet in Al Ain, approximately 1hr 30mins from Dubai and Abu Dhabi, in the UAE.
facilities: Three world class whitewater rafting & kayaking runs with a combined length of 1,133m. A surf pool capable of making a 3.3m high waves with a man made beach. Rope course, climbing wall and zip line. Restaurants, retail, VIP chalets, and conference/event facilities. Space and infrastructure for world class events. Training at levels for specialised activities. Adult & toddlers swimming pool
entryFees: All-Day Admissions: 1) Standard 50 AED. 2) Child 25 AED. 3) Guardian 25 AED. Infant: Free
Sunset Admission (5pm-closing): Standard 25 AED. Child: free
Airpar and Zip line: 50 AED/All day
Lessons vary. All prices above are subject to change.

location.displayAddress: Wild Wadi, Jumeirah, Dubai

name: Wild Wadi
description: Located in Dubai and situated in front of the stunning Burj Al Arab, Wild Wadi offers 30 rides and attractions for all the family. Wild Wadi is themed around the tale of Juha, a known character from the Arabian folklore.
facilities: But for those thrill seekers amongst you, check out the adrenaline fuelled rides at Wild Wadi Water Park including the incredible Tantrum Alley and Burj Surj! Last but by no means least, our Wipeout and Riptide Flowriders offer the ultimate surfing experience. One of only four such rides in the world, the Wipeout Flowrider is a blast.
entryFees: General Admissions: 1) Standard 275 AED. 2) Child (Under 1.1m) 175 AED
Annual Pass: 1) Adult 2000 AED. 2) Child (Under 1.1m) 1000 AED
All prices above are subject to change.
hours: Wild Wadi is planning its annual maintenance programme and the entire park will be closed from 12 January until 13 February 2014 inclusively and will re-open to public on 14 February 2014.

location.displayAddress: Ferrari World, Yas Island, Abu Dhabi

name: Ferrari World
description: Ferrari World Abu Dhabi is the world’s first Ferrari theme park and largest attraction of its kind. It is an intense multi-sensory experience and a must-visit for families, fans and enthusiasts. The Park offers more than 20 Ferrari-inspired rides and attractions, including a diverse array of rides for adults and children, a wide variety of Italian delicacies, and unique shopping experiences.
facilities: Ferrari World Abu Dhabi features more than 20 rides and attractions designed to tell the Ferrari story in ways which will appeal to a broad audience of different ages and interests. From the world’s fastest roller coaster, to advanced racing simulators, driving and scenic experiences; families, children, thrill seekers and racing fans can all find and enjoy unforgettable experiences at Ferrari World Abu Dhabi.
entryFees: Premium Admission (valid for 6 months)(include fasttrack): 440 AED
Premium Junior Admission (valid for 6 months)(under 1.3m)(include fasttrack): 365 AED
Annual Pass and Yas Island Pass are available. Check prices.
All prices above are subject to change.
